model_info.description: WhereIsAI/UAE-Large-V1 is a state-of-the-art text embedding model developed by WhereIsAI, achieving SOTA performance on the MTEB Leaderboard with an average score of 64.64. It uses a BERT-based architecture (110M parameters) with 'cls' pooling and a 512-token context window, optimized for universal NLP tasks through angle-optimized loss in complex space. The model is MIT-licensed and supports OpenAI-compatible API integration.
use_cases: Information retrieval from large text corpora
Search engine enhancements with semantic understanding
Content management and organization of document collections
strengths: Achieves state-of-the-art performance on MTEB with an average score of 64.64
Innovative AnglE architecture addresses vanishing gradients via angle optimization in complex space
Compact BERT-based design (110M parameters) balances efficiency and performance
MIT license allows free use in any scenario
OpenAI-compatible API and multi-framework support (angle_emb, sentence-transformers)
High classification accuracy (75.58 average) and strong pair classification (87.25 average)
limitations: Primarily optimized for English text with limited multilingual support
512-token context window restricts input length (BERT-based limitation)
Smaller model size (110M parameters) may limit capabilities compared to LLM-based embeddings
May require fine-tuning for highly specialized domains
Clustering performance (46.73 average) lags behind other tasks
